column4: hi, I having problems to connect to the internet. When I click the small network icon on upper right corner there is no eth0 connected is this normal? What is happening?
sudo ifconfig -a ,is eth0 available?
This is the output http://codepad.org/BHrSULHu
so, eth0 is there but it's not configured
I do not know how to configure it manually ... could guide me on that?
sure, you need some info like, ip address default getway and DNS if you need it
I really do not know how to gather this information ... what should I do?
do you have any other operational computer nearby?, if yes get the info from it
are you on Ubuntu at this moment?
no I do not. unfortunately.
yes
so I suppose eth1 is the interface plugged, right?
yes
I have just installed 9.10 it worked just fine with 9.04
then just plug the other interface and you'll have eth0 configured, you'll lose connection one moment, eth0 will replace eth1
unplug eth1 and plug the other interface
sorry, but I do not know how to do it . But it must be plugged , I was using the pc yesterday normally, I did not unplugged anything ...
working with eth1 will be just fine, don't worry about eth0
well I would like to fix this .
sudo lspci -v
http://codepad.org/4J6Hejsh
you have 2 Gigabit Ethernet controllers

if you want to fix then  then unplug your current connection(the cable) and connect the cable to the other interface, just that, you'll lose connection one moment, but you'll be online after a seconds
you're welcome :)
